job.title: Linux System Engineer II
job.description:
DISH is a Fortune 250 company with more than $13 billion in annual revenue that continues to redefine the communications industry. Our legacy is innovation and a willingness to challenge the status quo, including reinventing ourselves. We disrupted the pay-TV industry in the mid-90s with the launch of the DISH satellite TV service, taking on some of the largest U.S. corporations in the process, and grew to be the fourth-largest pay-TV provider. We are doing it again with the first live, internet-delivered TV service – Sling TV – that bucks traditional pay-TV norms and gives consumers a truly new way to access and watch television.
This role can be in either Cheyenne, WY or Gilbert, AZ
DISH is seeking an innovative and passionate Linux Engineer to join a team that manages the on-premise hardware/virtualization/OS/applications for the DISH Network conditional access systems. This position provides an opportunity to learn Docker and Kubernetes administration.
Primary Responsibilities:
Administer and manage server hardware, virtualization, and Linux OSs
Ensure high availability of conditional access applications in dev/test/prod environments
Work with engineering teams to deploy new features and upgrades
Manage system monitoring and alerting tools
Create and maintain technical documents and procedures
Required Qualifications:
BS in Computer Science or a related technical degree, or equivalent combination of education and experience
3+ years experience performing Linux system administration
3+ years working in a virtualized (VMware) Linux server environment
Scripting proficiency: Bash, Python, etc.
Strong critical thinking, decision making, and problem-solving skills
Strong desire to automate tasks
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Docker/Kubernetes
Experience with SaltStack, ArgoCD, Helm
Experience with Active Directory/Centrify
Experience with system performance tuning/testing
Familiarization with Scaled Agile/Scrum methodologies
#DICE_VP
Compensation: $55,800.00/Yr. - $87,450.00/Yr.
From versatile health perks to new career opportunities, check out our benefits on our careers website .
Employment is contingent on Successful completion of a pre-employment screen, which may include a drug test.
